ygData.subject: RE: Dungeon advice
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Yikes!  I tried Unrest at 18 and 19 and got into some of the worst groups I have ever seen.  The groups were far more horrifying than the mobs.  Get this,
ygData.messageBody:
> Permafrost, Runnyeye or Sol A might be ok. I didn't go to any of them
> quite that early, but the goblins at the entrance were green to me when

> However, if you haven't got a regular group yet, none of these dungeons
> is likely to be all that useful. The best place I found on my server to
> find pick up groups, where I eventually met people I ended up grouping
> with into the late 40's was Unrest.

Yikes! I tried Unrest at 18 and 19 and got into some of the worst groups I
have ever seen. The groups were far more horrifying than the mobs. Get
this, one group I was in, the cleric had the following spells memm'd at
level 17. Summon food, Summon drink, Hammer of Wrath, Smite, Furor, Light
Heal! and that's it! I know from the screenshot he emailed me of his
"awesome kill of a horrid undead via his amazing Smite spell" I get the
shivers every time I think of Unrest now, not from the mobs, just from the
pathetic groups I was in there. Verrrry scary. The close, but still
second worst, was the 19th level magician who insisted on tanking right up
there with his pet and pulling "cause he was the highest level and would get
less trash" I have never seen more bodies, nor greater reason for there to
be bodies in any zone I've been too except for the one time during the great
Squad Ring Massacre in Rivervale square. There were at least 50 bodies
there, of course they all belonged to the same six people.

Kitasi
greatly afeared of the PC's in Unrest
"Can't I just group with that dark-boned skeleton?
He's getting great xp soloing yellows..."
--
Artificial Intelligence stands no chance against Natural Stupidity.
